results.title: The Killing of Sister George
results.creator_credit: Robert Aldrich, Associates and Aldrich Company and Palomar Pictures
results.brief_description: The erosion of a longtime lesbian affair between a television star (Beryl Reid) who plays the role of “Sister George”, the bleeding heart heroine on a British TV soap opera, and her younger lover (Susannah York). The breakup of the relationship comes about when a broadcast executive who fancies the younger woman decides to write Reid out of her key TV role. The basic thrust of the plot is the gradual development of a rapport and sympathy with Reid, in inverse ratio to the loss of respect for York. The film received an X rating on its release due to a controversial five-minute lesbian love scene. Director Robert Aldrich achieved the look and feel of a “Made in Britain” picture, although most of it was shot near downtown LA. Cast also includes Carol Browne, Ronald Fraser, Patricia Medina and Hugh Paddick. Screenplay by Lukas Heller from the play by Frank Marcus.

results.title: Blood and sand
results.creator_credit: Rouben Mamoulian, Darryl F. Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Tyrone Power stars as a matador who started out as a ragged urchin and became the hero of his country. At the peak of his career he succumbs to the charms of a beautiful but cold-hearted woman. To win back the crowd with whom he has fallen out of favour, he risks his all and is fatally gored to death. Linda Darnell and Rita Hayworth star as the “femmes fatales” who cross paths with the matador. This is a lavish production which captures the atmosphere of the subject matter and brings to life the tragic tale created by Vicente Blasco in his novel.

results.title: Intermezzo
results.creator_credit: Gregory Ratoff, David O. Selznick and David O Selznick Productions
results.brief_description: A tragic but moving love story starring Ingrid Bergmann and Leslie Howard. The great concert violonist Holger Brandt is attracted to Anita Hoffman although he is happily married. He soon finds his love for Anita overwhelming and leaves his wife to tour Europe with her. But he cannot leave his past and his family ties behind and Anita sensing his dilemma, leaves him although it breaks her heart. Eventually Holgar and his wife are reunited as they share a personal tragedy. Sentimental, ‘Intermezzo’ is a great romantic classic.

results.title: Balto
results.creator_credit: Simon Wells, Steve Hickner, Amblin Entertainment and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on a true story, Balto is part husky/part wolf looking for a place to belong. An outcast in Alaska, he has few true friends - Boris the Russian snow goose, polar bear cubs Muk and Luk and the beautiful husky Jenna. Balto becomes a hero when the small town of Nome is struck by a diptheria epidemic. A blizzard means that medicine for the children cannot be delivered unless a team of sled dogs can race 600 miles to bring it back. When the dogs become lost, Balto must come to the rescue. Features the voices of Kevin Bacon, Bridget Fonda, Bob Hoskins and Phil Collins.

results.title: Manhattan murder mystery
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Robert Greenhut and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Woody Allen, Diane Keaton, Anjelica Huston and Alan Alda star in this slick comedy about marriage and murder. The sudden death of their neighbour has Carol, (Keaton) convinced that a murder has taken place. Larry (Allen) her nervy publisher husband of 20 years wants to ignore it, their friend Ted, (Alda) is excited by the thrill of the chase, while Marcia, (Huston), a shrewd author joins Carol in an hilarious chain of events to solve the mystery.

results.title: Murder on the orient express
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, Richard Goodwin, John Brabourne and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description:
Based on Agatha Christie’s famous novel, this Sidney Lumet Film has an all star cast. The legendary Belgian detective Hercule Poirot encounters a murder when he is aboard the famous Orient Express. The train is stuck in a snowdrift so the murderer is still on the train and Poirot must sort through a multitude of clues, lies and false trails before the truth can be revealed.
Cast includes: Albert Finney, Lauren Bacall, Martin Balsam, Ingrid Bergman, Jacqueline Bisset, Sean Connery, John Gielgud, Wendy Hiller, Anthony Perkins, Vanessa Redgrave, Richard Widmark and Michael York.

results.title: Evil under the sun
results.creator_credit: Guy Hamilton, Richard Goodwin, John Brabourne, Titan Film Productions and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: Peter Ustinov stars as Agatha Christie’s famed Belgian detective Hercule Poirot in this all-star production of ‘Evil under the sun’. Diana Rigg is bitchy Broadway musical star Arlena Marshall, on holiday with her husband and stepdaughter on an Adriatic island. The hotel is filled with people who have a reason to hate her and when she is found strangled on a beach, Poirot must exercise “his little grey cells” and find the murderer. Excellent costuming, a witty screenplay by Anthony Schaffer and a delightful Cole Porter soundtrack will delight.

results.title: Dating the enemy
results.creator_credit: Megan Simpson, Sue Milliken and Total Films
results.brief_description: Guy Pearce and Claudia Karvan star in this comedy which looks at the battle between the sexes from a new perspective. Brett and Tash fall in love but when a lack of compromise threatens their relationship, the forces of the universe intervene. One day they awake to find themselves prisoners in each other’s bodies. Brett learns that being a woman, particularly Tash, presents its own challenges, while Tash learns more than she had bargained for about the male psyche.

results.title: Flirt
results.creator_credit: Hal Hartley, Ted Hope, Nippon Film Development & Finance, Pandora Films and True Fiction Pictures
results.brief_description: If you’re interested in the art of storytelling, then you’ll enjoy “Flirt”. Hal Hartley takes the same narrative and retells it three times, changing the cultural and gender contexts of each story. Set in America, Berlin, and Tokyo, the same twisted love story unfolds with the same quirky twists and dramatic conclusion. Hartley flirts with the audience as he playfully includes many self-conscious allusions to his role as the ‘storyteller’, even including himself as a player in the final version of the narrative. While “Flirt” may not have the same dramatic intensity of some of Hartley’s other films, it becomes compelling through the differences and similarities revealed with each new unfolding of the narrative.

results.title: A Bronx tale
results.creator_credit: Robert De Niro, John Kilik, Jane Rosenthal and Tribeca Productions
results.brief_description: Calogero Anello is a streetwise nine year old whose father Lorenzo, fights to keep him from being corrupted by the neighbourhood in which they live. The boy witnesses a murder but refuses to identify Sonny, the local crime boss he has long admired, as the perpetrator. Sonny becomes a “surrogate” father to the boy, teaching him to survive in the streets. Over the next eight years, Lorenzo is powerless to stop his son from adopting the dangerous lifestyle of his hero Sonny. Robert De Niro stars and directs this often poignant but tragic motion picture.
